basics.name: Ryan Seymour
basics.label: Game Developer & E-Learning Coordinator
basics.summary: Seeking opportunities to expand game design knowledge in schools and universities and collaborate on engaging, educational games.

work.summary: Provide support for and maintain the organization's Learning Management System
highlights: Provide user support for the organization's Learning Management System to faculty and students.
Maintain LMS database functionality while providing support for server updates.
Project manager for students seeking to develop skills and projects related to game development.

work.position: Executive Assistant to the Dean of Undergraduate Education
work.summary: Organized and maintained the events and schedule of the Dean of Undergraduate Education and associated office
highlights: Maintained and developed Sharepoint databases for office workflows and processes

work.summary: Organized and maintained the events and schedule of the Dean of Undergraduate Education and associated office
highlights: Maintained and developed Sharepoint databases for office workflows and processes
Fluvanna Middle School,Life Science Student Teacher 2012-01 - 2012-07

volunteer.organization: Center for R Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: Darwin's Angry Finches
awards.summary: A small group activity, within a classroom environment where students choose a type of finch with a beak specific to a unique food source.  As the enviroment changed on the game board, student's finches either adapted and thrived or dwindled and went extinct.

awards.title: Fantasy Taxonomy
awards.summary: Students must work in teams to find the taxonomic location of fantasy animals from categories of domain  down to family.

awards.title: Sprouts
awards.summary: Players must grow a diverse group of crops for the Harvest Festival.  They must manage resources of energy, time, land, and currency to be named the best Harvest Festival gardener.

awards.title: Toxicity
awards.summary: Players shrink to microscopic size to destroy colonies of bacteria that have invaded a patients blood stream.

awards.title: Tour of Williamsburg
awards.summary: A 3-D representation of the historical buildings of Colonial Williamsburg whereby vistions can manuaver around the city in virtual reality.

awards.title: Museum Manager
awards.summary: A tycoon game whereby players take on the role as museum curator.  Players develop exhibit halls and restore masterpieces to enhance their donations while gaining availability to more artifacts.
